result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Logan Warren Hieneman

records.addlTxt:
1:31 PM Defendant Logan Warren Hieneman in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney John Miller Carroll appeared by ZOOM for Logan Warren Hieneman. 
Court calls case.
Atty Carroll heard - believes the case is resolved.
Requests a plea date be set.
Court schedules with parties.
1:38 PM
Plea hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Letter to Judge requesting ZOOM appearance - Request for ZOOM approved w/instructions attached

11:36 AM Attorney John Miller Carroll appeared by ZOOM for Logan Warren Hieneman.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Carroll heard - has notified Deft with all of the information for today's hearing.
Recess for Atty Carroll to contact the Deft.
11:46 Defendant Logan Warren Hieneman appeared by ZOOM.
Atty Carroll heard and requests a modification of the bond.
ADA heard - victim has completed the Rainbow House paperwork.
Agrees to modify bond but request the bond state no violent contact as part of the no contact order.
Court heard and modifies the bond: Deft may have contact with the victim, but may not have any violent contact with the victim.
Atty Carroll heard - will have the Deft sign an amended bond form and will file with the COC office within the next 10 days.
11:53 AM
Instructions on how to appear remotely

4:01 PM Defendant Logan Warren Hieneman in court.  Attorney John Miller Carroll in court for Logan Warren Hieneman.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Carroll heard on request to do initial appearance scheduled for 8/1/2022 on 22CF144 today
ADA has no objection
WOPH entered for both cases
Court goes off record 4:03PM
Back on record 4:06PM
Appearances are the same
Court heard on where 22CF144 left off in the initial appearance
ADA heard that nothing further needs to be addressed
Both cases move to PH 
Prelim quest/WOR provided
Def waives prelim
Court finds def freely waives prelim
Def bound over for trial 
Attorney Carroll requests to move straight to ARGN
ADA confirms complaint will track
Waives reading
Pleads n/g
Requests STC 
Attorney Carroll heard on request to modify bond
Court responds, unable to address bond
4:16PM
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 002539,
Payable Number: 90487,
Receipt Number: 22R 004117,
Amount: $20.00

8:55 AM Defendant Logan Warren Hieneman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Copy of complaint.
Court reviews charges and max penalties.
Deft understands.
Court inquires on atty.
Deft heard - has spoken to an attorney.
Atty Schraven is present and is heard - they have not evaluated the Deft yet.
Deft to contact the Public Defender today.
Court schedules with parties.
8:59 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:00 PM Defendant Logan Warren Hieneman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert Mraz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Brad Schraven is present from PD's office for bond purposes only.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Court inquires on Atty.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Schraven heard on bond.
Court imposes $1,000 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today w/o a valid Rx, no contact with father, may not live with father. 
Deft to contact the Public Defender's office today.
Court schedules with parties.
1:05 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
